text: Rautalampi is a municipality in Finland. The city has 3,451 people (as of 31 August 2012). It covers 761,97 km². Near Laihia are the municipalities Hankasalmi, Konnevesi, Pieksämäki, Suonenjoki, Tervo and Vesanto. ==History== History starts from 1561 when Sweden's king Gustav I of Sweden gave order to establish so called "hallintopitäjä" Rautalampi, (Rautalammen hallintopitäjä). ==Other websites== * website Category:Municipalities of North Savo Category:1560s establishments in Europe Category:16th-century establishments in Finland Category:1561 establishments Category:Disestablishments in Europe
title: Rautalampi
